alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots, frequent lightning and poor to very poor visibility in thunderstorms heavy at times are expected or occurring in the area.

A line of severe thunderstorms located from Devlin to Middlebro will move northward across the lake between 8.00 P.M. and 10.00 P.M CDT this evening.

###

Poor to very poor visibility may contribute to voyage delays and make marine navigation hazardous.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Vessels without lightning protection should make their way to shore immediately. Consider delaying or postponing travel in areas under the squall warning.

alerts.headline: squall watch in effect
alerts.description:
Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 50 knots, frequent lightning and hail.

A line of thunderstorms over Lower Michigan is expected to reach Canadian waters near midnight tonight.

###

Large hail can damage vessels and cause injury.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Vessels without lightning protection should make their way to shore immediately. Consider delaying or postponing travel in areas under the Squall Watch.

alerts.headline: severe thunderstorm watch in effect
alerts.description:
Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain.

What:
Wind gusts to 90 km/h.
Up to quarter size hail.
Heavy downpours.

When:
Overnight.

Additional information:
A line of thunderstorms approaching from Michigan will move east through the area tonight.

###

Local utility outages are possible. Damage to roofs, fences, branches or soft shelters is possible.

Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms capable of producing damaging hail, wind or rain.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

For more information: https://www.ontario.ca/page/be-prepared-emergency.
alerts.instruction:
When thunder roars, go indoors! Lightning kills and injures Canadians every year. Secure loose objects.

Emergency Management Ontario recommends that you take cover immediately if threatening weather approaches.

affected_areas.area_description: Watford - Pinery Park - Eastern Lambton County

alerts.headline: severe thunderstorm watch in effect
alerts.description:
Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain.

What:
Wind gusts to 100 km/h.
Up to toonie size hail.
Risk of a tornado.
Heavy downpours.

When:
Beginning near midnight for areas near the Michigan border and ending overnight.

Additional information:
A line of thunderstorms approaching from Michigan will move east through the area tonight.

###

Local utility outages are possible. Damage to roofs, fences, branches or soft shelters is possible.

Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms capable of producing damaging hail, wind or rain.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

For more information: https://www.ontario.ca/page/be-prepared-emergency.
alerts.instruction:
When thunder roars, go indoors! Lightning kills and injures Canadians every year. Secure loose objects.

Emergency Management Ontario recommends that you take cover immediately if threatening weather approaches.

alerts.headline: squall warning ended
alerts.description:
Squalls have weakened or moved out of the area.


###

alerts.headline: freezing rain warning in effect
alerts.description:
Ice build-up due to freezing rain Friday.

What:
Long duration freezing rain. 
2 to 5 mm of ice accretion.

When:
Beginning tonight and ending Friday afternoon, with the possibility of freezing rain lasting into Friday evening.

Additional information:
Light snow is expected to transition to freezing rain and ice pellets tonight. While precipitation is expected to remain light, the long duration of the freezing rain means that ice accretion of up to 5 mm is possible. Freezing rain could at times be mixed with ice pellets, especially late in the day on Friday, which could affect the total amount of ice build-up.

Surfaces such as walkways and parking lots will become icy, slippery and hazardous.

Beware of electrical wires that could break under the weight of ice.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

alerts.headline: freezing rain warning in effect
alerts.description:
Ice build-up due to freezing rain today.

What:
Long duration freezing rain. 
2 to 5 mm of ice accretion.

When:
Beginning early this morning and ending late this afternoon, with the possibility of a risk of freezing rain lasting into this evening.

Additional information:
Light snow is expected to transition to freezing rain or ice pellets early this morning. While precipitation is expected to remain light, the long duration of the freezing rain means that ice accretion of up to 5 mm is possible. Freezing rain could at times be mixed with ice pellets, especially this afternoon, which could affect the total amount of ice build-up. Freezing rain is expected to change over to ice pellets or snow this evening, 

Surfaces such as walkways and parking lots will become icy, slippery and hazardous.

Beware of electrical wires that could break under the weight of ice.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

alerts.headline: freezing rain warning in effect
alerts.description:
Ice build-up due to freezing rain today and tonight.

What:
Long duration freezing rain. 
2 to 5 mm of ice accretion.

When:
Patchy freezing rain early this morning then a risk of freezing rain later today.
Freezing rain tonight.

Additional information:
Patchy freezing rain early this morning is expected to transition later this morning to rain with a risk of freezing rain. Precipitation is expected to transition back to freezing rain early this evening. While the freezing rain is expected to remain light, the long duration means that ice accretion of up to 5 mm is possible. Freezing rain is expected to change over to ice pellets or snow early Saturday morning.

Surfaces such as walkways and parking lots will become icy, slippery and hazardous.

Beware of electrical wires that could break under the weight of ice.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

Additional information:
While precipitation is expected to remain light, the long duration of the freezing rain means that ice accretion of up to 5 mm is possible. Freezing rain is expected to change over to ice pellets or snow this evening,

Beware of electrical wires that could break under the weight of ice.

###

alerts.headline: freezing rain warning in effect
alerts.description:
Ice build-up due to freezing rain today and tonight.

What:
Long duration freezing rain. 
2 to 5 mm of ice accretion.

When:
Rain with a risk of freezing rain continues today.
Freezing rain this evening.

Additional information:
Rain will continue today, however with temperatures hovering just above the freezing mark, a risk of freezing rain is present. Precipitation is expected to transition to freezing rain this evening. While the freezing rain is expected to remain light, the long duration means that ice accretion of up to 5 mm is possible. Freezing rain is expected to change over to ice pellets or snow early Saturday morning.

Surfaces such as walkways and parking lots will become icy, slippery and hazardous.

Beware of electrical wires that could break under the weight of ice.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

alerts.description:
Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots, frequent lightning and poor to very poor visibility in thunderstorms heavy at times.

Thunderstorms are expected to develop over Michigan and track over the area  later this evening. The squall threat should end by Saturday morning.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Vessels without lightning protection should make their way to shore immediately.

alerts.headline: freezing rain warning in effect
alerts.description:
Ice build-up due to freezing rain tonight.

What:
Long duration freezing rain. 
2 to 5 mm of ice accretion.

When:
Freezing rain mixed with rain will end by Saturday morning.

Additional information:
Freezing rain mixed with rain will continue tonight. While the freezing rain is expected to remain light, the long duration means that ice accretion of up to 5 mm is possible. Freezing rain is expected to change over to ice pellets or snow early Saturday morning.

Surfaces such as walkways and parking lots will become icy, slippery and hazardous.

Beware of electrical wires that could break under the weight of ice.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
